content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = Vector{SubArray{Char, 1, AbstractVector{Char}, Tuple{UnitRange{Int}}, true}[]
    current_line = Char[c for c in text if isascii(c)]
    current_index = 1
    for i in 1:length(text)
        if current_index == text_width || i == length(text):
            lines += [current_line]
            current_line = Char[]
            current_index = 0
        elseif isascii(text[i]) && cw < ' '
            current_line[current_index] = current_char[1]
            current_index += 1
        end
    end
    return lines
end
```

Example usage:
```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello World! This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped into multiple lines.")
8-element Vector{SubArray{Char, 1, AbstractVector{Char}, Tuple{UnitRange{Int}}, true}:
 SubArray{Char, 1, Vector{Char}, Tuple{Slice{Base.OneTo{Int}}}, true}["Hello World! This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped into multiple lines."]
```
